Technologies 
 
 •  Programming in MUMPS (M, Cache, ObjectScript) since 1973 
 •  Programming in HTML/PHP/MySQL developing web applications since 2002

 •  Data General Eclipse/Nova & PDP-11 Miis - Meditech ('73-'76, '79-'81, '87-'90)

  Washington, D.C. 
  Org: Medical User (Hospitals and Clinics) 
  HW/OS: Windows Cache - InterSystems 
  SW: VA Vista/DHCP Hospital Information System 
 
• Implemented enhancements and software bug fixes to the OneVA Pharmacy module of VistA, which 
allows any VA hospital to access the medical records at any other VA hospital. 
  
3. United States Department of Defense  [’15-‘16] 
  Washington, D.C.

SW: DOD Electronic Medical Record (Variant of VA Vista)

development environment.

system installation, updating and configuration, importing and exporting application and patches, and 
Code Management. 
• Wrote  utility  programs  to  interface  a  Cache Integrated  Development  Environment with  the  GIT 
Version  Control  System,  and  to  determine  the  classes  and  routines  executed,  and  database  updates 
performed by a running MUMPS process.

Partners Healthcare  ['13-‘14] 
  Charlestown, MA

  SW: Interfaced a 3rd party Data Deidentification Application & a Hospital Information System 
 
• Developed a system to automatically create an XML SQL DataBase definition for an arbitrary 
Cache DataBase by parsing the software for database accesses and sampling the database to determine 
record and field formats. 
• Generated 96,000 SQL Table definitions for Partners' 114 medical applications to allow a 3rd party 
Data Deidentification Application to deidentify any Protected Health Information under the HIPAA 
Act.

Dear Employer, 
 
I have been programming in the MUMPS (M, Cache) programming language since 1973.  My entire professional 
career has been devoted to MUMPS and some internet programming.    I have worked for: 
 
 18 Hospitals 
 6 HMO's (Health Maintenance Organizations) 
 4 Universities 
 5 Commercial Laboratories 
 17 Vendors 
 
for a total of 50 different organizations.  Much of my work has been with the popular IDX/GE Systems.
